value.title: Power BI for Tableau users
value.excerpt: Are you a Tableau user who needs to learn Microsoft Power BI? This learning path enables you to leverage your existing Tableau skills to create power data-driven reports and dashboards in Power BI. You will learn to use the Microsoft Power BI desktop application and the Power BI service to connect to data, model and visualize data, and then share you findings. Finally, we provide guidance on how to produce and maintain optimized Power BI solutions.

topItems.title: Introduction to Power BI for Tableau users
topItems.excerpt: The purpose of this module is to help Tableau analysts switch from Tableau to Microsoft Power BI.

topItems.title: Connect data to Power BI for Tableau users
topItems.excerpt: This module provides the foundational information needed to connect to your data confidently with the new platform.

topItems.title: Create Power BI calculations for Tableau users
topItems.excerpt: This module provides guidance on Power BI calculation concepts, and how to create and edit calculations.

topItems.title: Organize and simplify Power BI fields for Tableau users
topItems.excerpt: This module provides guidance on how to organize and simplify your calculations.

value.title: Perform analytics in Power BIÂ
value.excerpt: You will learn how to use Power BI to perform data analytical functions, how to identify outliers in your data, how to group data together, and how to bin data for analysis. You will also learn how to perform time series analysis. Finally, you will work with advanced analytic features of Power BI, such as Quick Insights, AI Insights, and the Analyze feature.

value.title: Append and Merge Tables in Power BI

value.excerpt: Computing the rolling 12-months average in DAX looks simple, but it hides some level of complexity.  This article explains how to write the best formula and how to avoid common pitfalls using time intelligence functions. Article and download: https://sql.bi/15161?aff=yt  How to learn DAX: https://www.sqlbi.com/guides/dax/?aff=yt

value.title: Create dashboards in Power BI
value.excerpt: Microsoft Power BI dashboards are different than Power BI reports. Dashboards allow report consumers to create a single artifact of directed data that is personalized just for them.  Dashboards can be comprised of pinned visuals that are taken from different reports. Where a Power BI report uses data from a single dataset, a Power BI dashboard can contain visuals from different datasets.

value.title: CreateÂ paginated reportsÂ Â
value.excerpt: Paginated reports allow report developers to create Power BI artifacts that have tightly controlled rendering requirements. Paginated reports are ideal for creating sales invoices, receipts, purchase orders, and tabular data. This module will teach you how to create reports, add parameters, and work with tables and charts in paginated reports.

value.title: Create a data-driven story with Power BI reports
value.excerpt: Power BI helps you create vibrant, highly useful reports that form a cohesive, data-driven story. Youâll learn how to use buttons, bookmarks, and other navigation techniques. Additionally, youâll learn how to integrate Power BI reports with other applications. Power BI visuals can interact with each other, letting the user see exactly which data is appealing to them. Youâll also explore Power BI report themes to create a unified reporting experience across all reports.

value.title: Clean, transform, and load data in Power BI
value.excerpt: Learn how to clean, transform, and load data in Power BI.

value.title: Publish and share in Power BI
value.excerpt: Publish and share your Power BI reports and dashboards to teammates in your organization or to everyone on the web.
